name: Phishing and Training Campaign Planning Resources
title: Phishing and Training Campaign Planning Resources
body:
When planning a new phishing or training campaign, we recommend that you start by outlining your campaign settings using our interactive planning worksheets. You can use these worksheets to plan your campaign before you create it in your KSAT console. You can also share your planning sheet internally to inform other admins and stakeholders about the new campaign.

To download our campaign planning worksheets, see the links below:

Open Phishing Campaign Settings PDF Open Training Campaign Settings PDF
Tip: We also have a downloadable worksheet to help you plan and build Smart Groups. To download the Smart Groups worksheet, see our Smart Groups Quickstart Guide.

images.alt:
This document is an interactive worksheet titled **"Phishing Campaign Settings,"** branded KnowBe4 and identified as **PAGE 1**. The introductory text describes the worksheet's purpose: planning and sharing phishing campaign settings with stakeholders or administrators.

The worksheet is divided into configuration sections using labeled input fields, checkboxes, and radio buttons:

**I. Campaign Definition and Targeting**

*   **Campaign Name:** Required input field.
*   **Send to:** Radio button selection between `All Users` and `Specific Groups`. A large text area is provided for group input.

**II. Scheduling and Frequency**

*   **Frequency:** Checkbox selection with options: `One-Time`, `Biweekly`, `Quarterly`, `Weekly`, and `Monthly`.
*   **Start Date, Time, Time Zone:** Separate input fields for defining the campaign start.
*   **Sending Period:** Checkbox options to control email distribution speed:
    1.  `Send all emails when the campaign starts`.
    2.  `Send emails over [Input] business days/weeks/months`.

**III. Tracking Settings**

*   **Track Activity:** Input field followed by the unit specifiers (`days/weeks/months`) to define the tracking duration after the last email is sent.
*   **Track Replies to Phishing Emails:** Yes/No radio button selection.
*   **Custom Reply-to Address Domain:** Input field.
*   **Keep reply content for later review:** Yes/No radio button selection.
*   **Record out of office replies:** Yes/No radio button selection.

**IV. Template Selection**

*   **Template Categories:** Large input field for category specification.
*   **Category Selection:** Checkbox options for template sourcing: `AIDA Selected`, `Random`, `Full Random`, and `Specific Template` (the last includes a dedicated input field).

**V. Localization**

*   **Send Localized Emails:** Yes/No radio button selection.

This document is an "INTERACTIVE WORKSHEET" titled **"Training Campaign Settings,"** branded with the "KnowBe4" logo in the upper right corner. It is labeled "PAGE 1" at the bottom right.

A descriptive text block states the purpose: "Use this worksheet to plan your training campaign settings. You can also use this worksheet to share your campaign settings with stakeholders or other admins in your organization."

The document consists of multiple configuration sections using labeled input fields, checkboxes, and radio buttons:

**I. Campaign Identity and Timing**

*   **Campaign Name:** Single-line input field.
*   **Start Date:** Configured via three inputs: Date (with calendar icon), Time, and Time Zone.
*   **End Date:** Uses three mutually exclusive radio buttons/checkboxes:
    *   Specific Date (includes date input with calendar icon, Time, and Time Zone inputs).
    *   Relative Duration (includes a numerical input field followed by the unit label "days/weeks/months").
    *   No End Date.
*   **Allow assignments to be completed after due date:** Configured via "Yes" or "No" radio buttons.
*   **Content:** Large, multi-line text area input box.

**II. Behavior and Enrollment**

*   **Enable Content Survey:** Configured via "Yes" or "No" radio buttons.
    *   If Yes option is selected, a subordinate setting appears: "(If Yes) Allow users to leave comments:" configured via "Yes" or "No" radio buttons.
*   **Track Scores:** Configured via "Yes" or "No" radio buttons.
*   **Enroll Groups:** Configured via two selection options (checkboxes):
    *   All Users.
    *   Specific Groups (followed by a large, multi-line text area input box for listing groups).

**III. Automation and Remediation**

*   **Enable automatic enrollment for new users:** Configured via "Yes" or "No" radio buttons.
*   **Enable progress reset for remedial training:** Configured via "Yes" or "No" radio buttons.
*   **Add Completed Users To (Optional):** Single-line input field.
*   **Remove Completed Users From (Optional):** Single-line input field.
